d99da2e7e409487a2c5062c01293522e0a67","dweb:/ipfs/QmdPpdL279GtwxFVhEMuPfpX1q1QWe7ckshJMFwQuXAHaS"]}},"version":1}

decreaseDefaults(uint256).details: The value "amount" should be standardized to WEI.

params.amount: The default amount that has been resolved.

increaseDefaults(uint256).details: The value "amount" should be standardized to WEI.

initializeGlobals(address[]).details: This function should only be called once.

params.globals: Array of addresses representing all core system contracts.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.asset: The asset (ERC-20) from which to standardize the amount to WEI.

returns.standardizedAmount: The above amount standardized to 18 decimals.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

transferOwnershipAndLock(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.status: The status to assign to the "keeper" (true = allowed, false = restricted).

params.allowed: The value to assign (true = permitted, false = prohibited).

updateLowerRatioIncentive(uint256).details: A value of 2,000 represents 20%, indicating that minimum $ZVE incentives are offered for         minting $zJTT (Junior Tranche Tokens) when the actual tranche ratio is 20%.         Likewise, due to inverse relationship between incentivices for $zJTT and $zSTT minting,         a value of 2,000 represents 20%, indicating that maximum $ZVE incentives are offered for         minting $zSTT (Senior Tranche Tokens) when the actual tranche ratio is 20%.

params.lowerRatio: The lower ratio to handle incentivize thresholds.

updateMaxTrancheRatio(uint256).details: A value of 2,000 represent 20% (basis points), meaning the junior tranche          at maximum can be 20% the size of senior tranche.

params.allowed: The value to assign (true = permitted, false = prohibited).

updateUpperRatioIncentives(uint256).details: A value of 2,000 represents 20%, indicating that maximum $ZVE incentives are offered for         minting $zJTT (Junior Tranche Tokens) when the actual tranche ratio is 20%.         Likewise, due to inverse relationship between incentivices for $zJTT and $zSTT minting,         a value of 2,000 represents 20%, indicating that minimum $ZVE incentives are offered for         minting $zSTT (Senior Tranche Tokens) when the actual tranche ratio is 20%.

params.upperRatio: The upper ratio to handle incentivize thresholds.

adjustedSupplies().notice: Returns total circulating supply of zSTT and zJTT, accounting for defaults via markdowns.

decreaseDefaults(uint256).notice: Call when a default is resolved, decreases net defaults system-wide.

increaseDefaults(uint256).notice: Call when a default occurs, increases net defaults system-wide.

initializeGlobals(address[]).notice: Initialze the variables within this contract (after all contracts have been deployed).

standardize(uint256,address).notice: Handles WEI standardization of a given asset amount (i.e. 6 decimal precision => 18 decimal precision).

updateLowerRatioIncentive(uint256).notice: Updates the lower ratio between tranches for minting incentivization model.

updateMaxTrancheRatio(uint256).notice: Updates the maximum size of junior tranche, relative to senior tranche.

updateMaxZVEPerJTTMint(uint256).notice: Updates the max $ZVE minted per stablecoin deposited to ZivoeTranches.sol.

updateMinZVEPerJTTMint(uint256).notice: Updates the min $ZVE minted per stablecoin deposited to ZivoeTranches.sol.

updateUpperRatioIncentives(uint256).notice: Updates the upper ratio between tranches for minting incentivization model.

documentation.text: @dev The ZivoeDAO.sol contract.
@dev The ZivoeITO.sol contract.
@dev The ZivoeRewards.sol ($zJTT) contract.
@dev The ZivoeRewards.sol ($zSTT) contract.
@dev The ZivoeRewards.sol ($ZVE) contract.
@dev The ZivoeRewardsVesting.sol ($ZVE) vesting contract.
@dev The ZivoeYDL.sol contract.
@dev The ZivoeTrancheToken.sol ($zJTT) contract.
@dev The ZivoeTrancheToken.sol ($zSTT) contract.
@dev The ZivoeToken.sol contract.
@dev The Zivoe Laboratory.
@dev The ZivoeTranches.sol contract.
@dev The Governor contract.

@dev This ratio represents the maximum size allowed for junior tranche, relative to senior tranche.
      A value of 2,000 represent 20%, thus junior tranche at maximum can be 20% the size of senior tranche.
@dev These two values control the min/max $ZVE minted per stablecoin deposited to ZivoeTranches.sol.
@dev These values represent basis points ratio between zJTT.totalSupply():zSTT.totalSupply() for maximum rewards (affects above slope).
@dev Tracks net defaults in system.
@dev Whitelist for keepers, responsible for pre-initiating actions.
@dev Whitelist for lockers, for DAO interactions and accounting accessibility.
@notice Initializes the ZivoeGlobals.sol contract.

@notice Emitted during initializeGlobals().
 @param controller The address representing Zivoe Labs / Dev entity.

@notice Updates the min $ZVE minted per stablecoin deposited to ZivoeTranches.sol.
 @param  min Minimum $ZVE minted per stablecoin.

@notice Updates the max $ZVE minted per stablecoin deposited to ZivoeTranches.sol.
 @param  max Maximum $ZVE minted per stablecoin.
@notice    This contract handles the global variables for the Zivoe protocol.
